greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest multiplier w such that A002110(n)*w + prime(n+1)^2 is prime.
comment: For n=1,2,3,4,6,13,19,28,41,66,85,..., A002110(n) + prime(n+1)^2 is a prime; i.e., the multiplier w is 1.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500
mathematica: Table[Function[{P, q}, w = 1; While[! PrimeQ[P w + q], w++]; w] @@ {Times @@ #2, First[#1]^2} & @@ # &@ TakeDrop[Take[#, n], -1], {n, 2, Length@ #}] &@ Prime@ Range@ 84 (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 14 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {my(m=1, primo=prod(k=1, n, prime(k))); while (!isprime(primo*m + prime(n+1)^2), m++); m;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 20 2017
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 25 2000
